headline.print_headline: Invitation to a Dialogue: Alternatives to Prison
headline.main: Invitation to a Dialogue: Alternatives to Prison

docs.snippet: A law student says jails should be used to protect public safety but not for punishment. Readers are invited to reply....
docs.lead_paragraph: A law student says jails should be used to protect public safety but not for punishment. Readers are invited to reply.

headline.print_headline: Rice Concedes Error on Libya; G.O.P. Digs In
headline.seo: Ambassador Rice Concedes Error on Libya, but G.O.P. Senators Are Not Satisfied
headline.main: Rice Concedes Error on Libya; G.O.P. Digs In

docs.snippet: Three Senate Republicans signaled that they would still oppose Susan E. Rice, the ambassador to the United Nations, if she is nominated for secretary of state....
docs.abstract: Senate Republicans Lindsey Graham, Kelly Ayotte and John McCain, after meeting with United Nations ambassador Susan E Rice, signal they will still oppose her if she is nominated for secretary of state; Rice concedes errors in the account of the deadly attack on the American diplomatic mission in Benghazi, Libya, shortly after it occurred in September.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and JEREMY W. PETERS
byline.contributor: Jennifer Steinhauer and Eric Schmitt contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: Three Senate Republicans signaled that they would still oppose Susan E. Rice, the ambassador to the United Nations, if she is nominated for secretary of state.

headline.print_headline: More Than a Murmur, Not Yet a Roar
headline.seo: The Nets in Brooklyn — More Than a Murmur, but Not Yet a Roar
headline.main: More Than a Murmur, Not Yet a Roar

docs.snippet: When Brooklyn fans can be heard at a Knicks-Nets game at Madison Square Garden, then we will know their team has arrived citywide....
docs.abstract: Harvey Araton On Pro Basketball column notes that while Brooklyn Nets are gaining fans, there were still plenty of New York Knicks supporters present when teams played at Barclays Center; maintains that if Brooklyn fans make a significant showing at Madison Square Garden it will be clear the Nets have arrived citywide.
docs.lead_paragraph: When Brooklyn fans can be heard at a Knicks-Nets game at Madison Square Garden, then we will know their team has arrived citywide.

headline.print_headline: Protesters Hurt In Crackdown On Tibetans
headline.seo: Tibet Protesters Hurt in Crackdown; Self-Immolations Continue
headline.main: Tibetan Protesters Injured in Crackdown; Self-Immolations Continue

docs.snippet: At least five Tibetans have set fire to themselves in recent days, and at least 20 Tibetan students were injured after security forces cracked down on a large protest in western China....
docs.abstract: At least five Tibetan students are in critical condition and 15 others are being treated for injuries after security forces crack down on large protest in western China to demand equal rights for ethnic minorities; protest reportedly began in response to official booklet condemning Tibetans who have set themselves on fire in protest of Chinese rule.
docs.lead_paragraph: At least five Tibetans have set fire to themselves in recent days, and at least 20 Tibetan students were injured after security forces cracked down on a large protest in western China.

headline.print_headline: Bronx Jurors Get Manslaughter Case Against Bus Driver in Crash That Killed 15
headline.seo: Jury Hears Closing Statements in Ophadell Williams’s Trial
headline.main: Bronx Jurors Get Manslaughter Case Against Bus Driver in Crash That Killed 15

docs.snippet: A judge delivered final instructions to the jury in the manslaughter case of Ophadell Williams, the driver of a Chinatown bus that crashed last year....
docs.abstract: Judge delivers final instructions to Bronx jury as they begin deliberations in manslaughter case of Ophadell Williams, driver of Chinatown bus that crashed in 2011; case centers on question of whether Williams was so dangerously fatigued when he got behind wheel that he should be found criminally liable.
docs.lead_paragraph: A judge delivered final instructions to the jury in the manslaughter case of Ophadell Williams, the driver of a Chinatown bus that crashed last year.

headline.print_headline: The Bargainer Who Remade the Old Ball Game
headline.seo: Marvin Miller, Union Leader Who Changed Baseball, Dies at 95
headline.main: Marvin Miller, Union Leader Who Changed Baseball, Dies at 95

docs.snippet: By building the Major League Baseball Players Association into a force that revolutionized the game, Mr. Miller became one of the most influential figures in the sport’s history....
docs.abstract: Marvin Miller, economist and labor leader who became one of most important figures in baseball history by building major league players union into force that revolutionized game and transformed all of professional sports, dies at age 95.
docs.lead_paragraph: By building the Major League Baseball Players Association into a force that revolutionized the game, Mr. Miller became one of the most influential figures in the sport’s history.

headline.seo: A Rivalry Grows in Brooklyn — Leading Off

docs.snippet: The Nets and Knicks are tied for the lead in the Atlantic Division, and that infused Monday’s game with new meaning....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Nets and Knicks are tied for the lead in the Atlantic Division, and that infused Monday’s game with new meaning.

headline.print_headline: Egypt Protesters Gather to Denounce Morsi in Scenes Recalling Uprising
headline.seo: Protesters Gather Again in Cairo Streets to Denounce Morsi
headline.main: Egypt Protesters Gather to Denounce Morsi in Scenes Recalling Uprising

docs.snippet: President Mohamed Morsi’s attempt to soften his edict did little to constrain the crowd, which some estimates put at hundreds of thousands of people....
docs.abstract: Tens of thousands of people fill central Tahrir Square in Cairo in outpouring of rage at President Mohamed Morsi's claims that his decisions are above judicial review and at role played in politics by Muslim Brotherhood, to which some remain implacably opposed.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK
byline.contributor: Mayy El Sheikh and Mai Ayyad contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Mohamed Morsi’s attempt to soften his edict did little to constrain the crowd, which some estimates put at hundreds of thousands of people.

headline.print_headline: A Comment on the Budget Impasse Sends Markets Lower
headline.seo: A Comment on the Budget Impasse Sends Markets Lower
headline.main: A Comment on the Budget Impasse Sends Markets Lower

docs.snippet: A note of frustration by the Senate majority leader, and stock indexes sink....
docs.abstract: Stocks slump on Wall Street after Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid says he is frustrated by the lack of progress in talks over the fiscal situation in Washington.
docs.lead_paragraph: A note of frustration by the Senate majority leader, and stock indexes sink.
